chatgpt_double_star.new_statement: Keep the Electoral College’s state-based structure but reduce “all-or-nothing” outcomes by encouraging states to allocate electors more proportionally and by standardizing congressional-district maps if districts are used, so the rules can’t be gamed. In parallel, allow a national popular-vote interstate compact only with clear safeguards—uniform voter eligibility and ballot-counting standards, transparent reporting, routine risk-limiting audits, and automatic recount thresholds—to ensure the result is verifiable and widely accepted. Any reforms should be phased in and evaluated after each cycle to protect federal stability while making campaigns compete for votes across more of the country.

chatgpt_double_star_rankings.new_statement: Keep the state-based presidential election framework but curb winner-take-all distortions so every ballot has more comparable weight, primarily by moving states toward proportional or district-based allocation of electors. Allow an interstate compact that aligns the result with the national popular vote only with clear, enforceable rules and broad adoption. Pair any allocation change with simple, uniform baseline standards for ballot access, counting, audits, and recount triggers so outcomes are transparent, verifiable, and less dominated by a handful of swing states.

chatgpt_double_star_personas.new_statement: Keep a meaningful state role in running elections, but reduce winner‑take‑all distortions so more voters—rural and urban—feel their ballots matter by encouraging proportional or district-based allocation of electors and allowing an interstate popular‑vote compact only with clear, enforceable rules. Pair any change with simple, uniform baseline standards for ballot access, counting, certification timelines, and routine post‑election audits so outcomes are transparent, legally durable, and easier to accept. Reforms should be phased in and stress‑tested for administrative cost and security, and may include optional ranked‑choice voting in close contests to reduce spoiler fears and reward broader coalitions.
